page.title: 04Pig Farming
page.content: My father is a{farmer.}He often works with{pigs.}He has to go to work at 7.30 in the morning. When he gets to the farm he starts to{clean the pigs out. This will take him up to four hours to complete satisfactorily. He would then have a break and drink a cup of well deserved coffee. After the break he would start to {feed the pigs}and at one o' clock he would stop to have his own dinner. Then he would finish feeding the pigs. The pigs are fed{on a swill}made out of barley and water. When all the pigs are fed, my father would do odd jobs like{clipping {the young pigs'teeth}so that they do not get too sharp, or moving some pigs to another pen. He would then come home for tea at about five o'clock. STUART HOYSTED.
